channel.title: Turn off windows firewall
channel.description:
Heya all,
I have a problem with my windows firewall. I can't turn that stupid thing off! :o When i go to the settings, i can't change anything, cause all options are disabled. It says: M$ Windows Firewall is controlled by Group Policy.
I've googled alot (don't blame me.. :rolleyes:) and didn't found the solution. Anyone knows what to do? :) Thx I.A.
~S!ms

item.title: Turn off windows firewall
item.dc:creator: @Xerxes Xerxes
item.description:
@Xerxes wrote:

Try this:

  1. Click Start, Run and type Regedit.exe
  2. Navigate to the following locations:

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE \ SOFTWARE \ Policies \ Microsoft \ WindowsFirewall

-and-

HKEY_CURRENT_USER \ SOFTWARE \ Policies \ Microsoft \ WindowsFirewall

  1. Backup and then delete the WindowsFirewall key.
  2. Close Regedit.exe and restart Windows.

if that dosen’t work, find and delete these:

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsFirewall
\DomainProfile \EnableFirewall=0 (DWORD data type)

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsFirewall
\StandardProfile \EnableFirewall=0 (DWORD data type)

BACKUP REGISTRY FIRST OK THANKS I DONT WANT SHIT FROM YA LATER

Read full topic
